in the first place   your mistake in posting this was specifying that it s a sub for black people  i understand what you re all about  but you should ve anticipated what the reaction would be   hey  i wanna start a subreddit about soul food  because i firmly believe that only black people can speak authentically about soul food   just start the sub reddit  and make it clear that it s for aficionados of soul food  r authenticsoulfood nc   you will attract people who wanna share their authentic experiences  and i would guess 95  of those will be of african american heritage  maybe some people would wanna join simply to learn something if the content is good enough  i was thinking about starting a subreddit about german american or norwegian american cuisine  but i would never come out and announce to the general public that i only want those with the proper ethnic heritage to join because other opinions don t matter  food is food  everybody likes food  so if the group is to be about a specific type of food  you should ve just led with that upfront and you ll naturally attract the audience that you re looking for  it s about the content right  not necessarily the people  you need to adjust your thinking a bit  ""

judge bob orr and norm eisen on the bill   ""

legislative leaders in north carolina s legislature are attempting a cynical power grab  they proposed a 131 page bill  sb 382  posing as hurricane relief badly needed by residents in western north carolina  but a closer look reveals the legislation is packed with sweeping power grabs that dismantle democratic norms  rig the system and strip power from elected officials  in a moment when devastated communities need disaster recovery and leadership  these folks opted for political opportunism  dismantling democracies doesn t happen overnight  they are taken apart piece by piece and often through legislation disguised as something else entirely  just like this bill  ""

one of the most egregious provisions restructures the state board of elections  transferring appointment authority away from the governor  the board is made up of five members with a party split of three to two  currently giving the governor the power to decide the political leaning of the group with his appointment of the chair   a system that has long been in place under democratic and republican governors  but the new legislation attempts to move this power away from governor elect josh stein  a democrat  and towards the future state auditor  a republican  flipping the existing approach to gain control over the state s election apparatus  this gambit is akin to shooting an arrow and painting a bullseye around it  the bill also takes aim at judicial independence  according to the legislature s new bill  governors filling court vacancies are now forced to pick candidates from the departing judge s party  again undoing a practice both parties have had for decades and undermining gubernatorial independence  the bill shortens the time governor elect josh stein will have to fill legislative vacancies  limits consecutive appointments  and transfers key powers  such as the ability to appoint chairs of county election boards  to other offices  the cumulative effect is a systematic weakening of the executive branch  effectively neutering its ability to govern  ""
